newsitem.title: USA: Viacom ends talks with MCA over TV venture.
newsitem.headline: Viacom ends talks with MCA over TV venture.

text.p: Viacom Inc. said Friday it terminated settlement talks with Seagram Co. Ltd.'s MCA Inc. over their jointly-owned USA Network cable television channel.
A spokeswoman for Viacom said any proposal that Viacom may have had was no longer under consideration.

Viacom, which owns Paramount Pictures, MTV and Nickelodeon, and Seagram, the owners of entertainment and theme park concern MCA Inc., have been fighting for control of the cable channel, with each side accusing the other of violating the terms of the partnership agreement.
The case was put on hold earlier this week to give both sides an opportunity to reach a settlement.

According to published reports, Viacom and MCA were discussing a plan in which Viacom would receive MCA's half of the USA Network in return for Viacom's half of the Sci-Fi cable channel and a substantial cash settlement.

The deal would have given Viacom sole ownership of the USA cable network, which broadcasts a variety of programmes ranging from re-runs of "Murder, She Wrote" to original movies and the U.S. Open tennis tournament. In return, MCA would have received the less popular Sci-Fi channel, famous for broadcasting re-runs of "Lost in Space" and The Twilight Zone."
